body:
@hainest, I report here a couple of issues that @eschnett addressed trying to build boost on macOS.

- boost filesystem incompatibility with GCC (on darwin?)
https://github.com/boostorg/filesystem/issues/199
- boost in spack uses an incomplete tree (is it needed to run `b2 headers`?)
https://github.com/boostorg/property_map/issues/22

The above issues refers to develop branch of Boost (it was indicatively `boost-1.77.0.beta1` at the time of test), so they should affect also the next 1.77.0 release.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

Very well detailed reports can be found in the issues above (thanks @eschnett)

### Information on your system

@eschnett can you please report your `spack debug report` in the comments?

### General information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mentioned any maintainers
- [x] I have uploaded the build log and environment files (in the issues linked)
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
title: Installation issue: boost
